page.title: 01ROYSTON _ A SUMMARY
page.content: The location of this study is{Royston. It is a market town on the Herts/Cambs border about 45 miles/70 km North of London.Royston is situated at the foot of a chalk escarpment,an extension of the{Chiltern hills,}and on the edge of the flood plain of the{River Cam.}Its pop. is 11,000.Royston is growing in size.The{workforce}has changed from a traditional farming community to a commuting population.Reasons for this include improved electric{railway}and the new M11{motorway}which link London and Cambridge.Our D block contains a residential area surrounded by arable farmland.The larger part of the town is contained in the neighbouring D block and includes much of the industry and amenities of Royston.{The {information recorded on this disc is {compiled from the work of children in {two First Schools and a Middle School.
